author: Staff Reporter
text:
The wholesale price of egg in the Namakkal Zone has increased by four paise to be fixed at Rs. 4.06 on Saturday.

Officials of the National Egg Coordination Committee said that due to increase in demand for eggs, the price of egg was increased on Saturday and are hopeful that price may go up further in the coming days.

They added that prevailing intense cold in North India and end of Sabarimala season has improved the demand.

The price is expected to go up further as Thaipusam festival ends on January 24, they added. NECC price in various centres include Ahmadabad - Rs. 4.27, Chitoor - Rs. 4.13, Hyderabad - Rs. 3.85, Pune - Rs. 4.20, Vijayawada - Rs. 3.79 and Warangal - Rs. 3.88.
title: Wholesale price of egg rises
